Detailed Description

The main Logos application class.

In usual wxWidgets style, this class constitutes the program entry point. It creates the wxWizard and the various pages, links them together, and starts the wizard. When the wizard is closed, execution terminates.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

LogosApp::LogosApp ( )

Constructor.

We override the constructor to set a few internal wxWidgets settings, such as configuration paths.

Create the common Mac OS X menu bar.

void LogosApp::CreateWizard ( )

Create the Logos wizard.

This function creates the LogosWizard class. It may be called more than once, for example on Mac OS X.

void LogosApp::MacOpenFile ( const wxString &  filename) [virtual]

Mac override for drag-and-drop.

This is a special function used for drag-and-drop on OS X.

Parameters:
filenameFile dropped on the window
bool LogosApp::OnInit ( ) [virtual]

Called at the beginning of program execution.

This function does a little initialization, and then creates a wizard which takes over program execution.

Returns:
True if execution is to continue, false otherwise

void LogosApp::ShowHelp ( wxWindow *  parent = NULL,
const wxString &  filename = wxT("") 
)

Show a help page by filename.

This function opens the online help to a specific page. By default, filename is an empty string, which will show the help's contents. Note that the filename expected here is an internal .html file, specified as a relative path from the root of the documentation tree.

Parameters:
parentThe window to be the parent of the help dialog
filenameThe filename within the documentation tree to open. If empty, show the help contents.
